column2: 1. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.

column6: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column8: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 5. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: to suddenly run into the street.
column10: not to cross unless they are with an adult.

column2: 6. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 7. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?

column4: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column6: Always come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging

column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column8: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column10: drive slowly so you can check traffic.

column2: 13. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 14. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column10: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 15. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column6: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 16. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column10: The traffic signal ahead is out of order

column2: 18. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column10: get off the highway as quickly as possible.

column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 22. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 23. You are stopped at an intersection on a two-way street. Can you legally turn left on a red light into a one-way street?
column6: No. You must wait for the green light.
column8: Yes, but only if a left turn sign is posted.
column10: Yes, but only if there is a green arrow with the red light.

column2: 24. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column8: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 25. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column6: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 26. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.
column6: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column8: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.
column10: drive to the right side of the road and stop.

column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 29. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:

column4: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column8: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 32. The penalties for a first-time DUI Oregon offender include license suspension for:
33. Which shape is a stop sign?

column6: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 35. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
